titleInfo.title: Confederate Soldiers Monument in Centennial Park, Nashville, Tennessee, n.d.

mods.identifier: RG 412 089 Confederate Soldiers Monument Centennial Park 006

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: This monument features a statue by George Julian Zolnay of the Confederate boy hero, Sam Davis. The statue dressed in a Confederate uniform is seated on a rock and holding his rifle in one hand with its butt resting on the ground. The base of the monument is inscribed thus: “Duty Done Honor Won 1861-1865” on south, front of base, carved into stone; “To the Heroism of the Private Confederate Soldier,” on east, side of base, carved into stone; “Erected 1909 by,” on west, side of base, carved into stone; with a bronze plaque naming it was built by Frank Cheatham BIVOUAC #1 Association of Confederate Soldiers Camp #35, United Confederate Veterans, Nashville, Tennessee.” It also lists the names of the members of the Frank Cheatham Bivouac. On the north side, back of base, carved into stone is the quote “Faithful to the End.” Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
mods.accessCondition: U.S. and international copyright laws protect this digital content, which is provided for educational purposes only and may not be downloaded, reproduced, or distributed for any other purpose without written permission.
